body:
<!--e57a25ab6845829454e8d69fc972939a-->

The following sections might be updated with supplementary metadata relevant to reviewers and maintainers.

<!--174a7506f384e20aa4161008e828411d-->
### Conflicts
Reviewers, this pull request conflicts with the following ones:

* [#16710](https://drahtbot.github.io/bitcoin_core_issue_redirect/r/16710.html) (build: Enable -Wsuggest-override if available by hebasto)

If you consider this pull request important, please also help to review the conflicting pull requests. Ideally, start with the one that should be merged first.
Awesome, sorry could not make it home yesterday, fires still spreading! But iwill try tomorrow.

As a proof of concept and first time contribution this is pretty cool! Thanks for the PR. I built and ran on my macOS machine; it worked out of the box. 

Whilst I don't think this is something that we'd merge into this repository (for a number of reasons, although build system additions like #16110 are more welcome), it's definitely the kind of thing I'd like to see built on top of Bitcoin Core. As the [process separation](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/10102) and other refactoring work continues, building alternative GUIs should become easier.

> * verifying transactions only while in foreground or charging (to preserve battery)
> * enabling phone to phone transactions (NFC or bluetooth for enhanced privacy)
> * providing services to other local apps (think Lightning wallets, they could get the blockchain state from Core, no wasting of resources)

These are all interesting discussions to have, but would be best suited for the repository where this GUI code eventually lived. i.e We wouldn't want to end up having discussions about some Android NFC stack here. Although I assume you'd be leveraging Qt's built in support for either.

If you're interested in other mobile development, there is also a [PR open](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/12557) to try and support building for iOS devices. If you have other related thoughts / questions, feel free to reach out to me directly.
